workflow.name: Multi-account email classifier with AI, Gmail, Discord & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
# AI Email Classifier üì¨  
Automate Email Classification, Prioritization, and Spam Detection Across Multiple Accounts  

Created by: Jayant Kumar ([@jharilela](https://github.com/Jharilela))  
üõ† Powered by: Gmail, Google Sheets, OpenAI, Discord, and n8n  

---

## Sample Discord labelling as Spam

![ai-email-classifier-spam](https://articles.emp0.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/ai-email-classifier-spam.png)  

## Sample Discord labelling as Legit

![ai-email-classifier-legit](https://articles.emp0.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/ai-email-classifier-legit.png)  

---

## Why I Built This

Focus is Expensive. Managing multiple email inboxes every day‚Äîpersonal, business, partnerships, invoices. Logging into each, skimming through noise, flagging important stuff, and deleting spam started eating up hours of my week. I needed a system that helped me **focus** only on what matters without building an entire helpdesk dashboard.  

I already live in Discord. It made sense to push my emails there‚Äîbut in a fun, digestible, and actionable way. I built **AI Email Classifier üì¨** to summarize emails, detect spam, assign priority, and make everything skimmable with pictures and links.  

And it works across **multiple Gmail accounts**.

---

## Key Features

- ‚úÖ Works with **multiple Gmail inboxes**  
- üß† Uses AI to **classify spam vs legit**  
- üéØ Assigns **priority levels**: High / Medium / Low  
- üóÇ Appends everything to a **central Google Sheet**  
- üì∏ Sends **visual summaries to Discord** (with image + action links)  
- üõ† Powered by open-source: [n8n_discord_trigger_bot](https://github.com/Jharilela/n8n_discord_trigger_bot)

---

## How It Works

Here‚Äôs the high-level flow:

1. New Email in any inbox triggers the worfklow to start
2. The AI Agent reads the raw content, subject, sender, Gmail labels.
3. It calls a **Google Sheet** that acts as our feedback memory:
   - Emails and domains manually marked as **spam** or **legit**.
4. AI classifies the incoming email using logic:
   - **Spam** if sender or domain is blacklisted, or content matches patterns like:  
     _"promotions, phishing, ads, mass emails, cold offers"_  
   - **Priority** is assigned by:
     - **High**: deadlines, legal, payments, clients, CEO emails  
     - **Medium**: team updates, meetings, project notifications  
     - **Low**: newsletters, FYIs, casual threads  
6. It produces a compact JSON output with:
   - Sender, recipient, subject, summary, priority, priority color, image URL, action URL  
7. The message is formatted visually and posted back to Discord as an embed with:
   - Summary text  
   - Actionable links  
   - Priority color code  
   - Thumbnail (if any)  

---

## Google Sheet Training Table  

The system uses this sheet as live memory to label spam and legit senders:  

```
‚ïî‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¶‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¶‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¶‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¶‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïó
‚ïë       Email        ‚ïë    Domain    ‚ïë  Classification ‚ïë  Labelled By ‚ïë  Labelled Date ‚ïë
‚ï†‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¨‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¨‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¨‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï¨‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï£
‚ïë offers@badsite.com ‚ïë  badsite.com ‚ïë  Spam           ‚ïë  Jayant      ‚ïë  08/07/2025    ‚ïë
‚ïë ceo@trusted.com    ‚ïë  trusted.com ‚ïë  Legit          ‚ïë  Jayant      ‚ïë  08/07/2025    ‚ïë
‚ïö‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï©‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï©‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï©‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ï©‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïù

```


This allows **manual control** to teach the AI which senders to trust or ignore. Every time I see something marked wrong, I just reply in Discord with `"spam"` or `"legit"` on that message thread. That triggers an update to the Sheet via AI parsing and n8n.

---

## Why Manual Input Still Matters

AI isn‚Äôt perfect.  
Some spam emails are cleverly disguised. And some senders are contextually important only to *you*.

That‚Äôs why I kept a simple feedback loop:
- You tell the bot `"spam"` or `"legit"` on any Discord email message. Or anything along that line
- The AI agent detects the intent and updates the Sheet.
- The AI improves its judgment next time as it now **remembers** your preference

---

## Why Discord?

Because Slack charges per seat and email feels lonely.  
I run most of my operations inside Discord community chats, client rooms, bot alerts.  
Instead of making a full email UI, I turned each email into a **Discord card with a thumbnail, summary, and quick actions**.  
It‚Äôs fun. It‚Äôs visual. It doesn‚Äôt feel like work.  
Email becomes more like a game feed.

---

## Tech Stack

- Gmail ‚Üí Discord via Gmail trigger node
- Discord ‚Üí n8n Webhook via [`n8n_discord_trigger_bot`](https://github.com/Jharilela/n8n_discord_trigger_bot)  
- OpenAI GPT-4o (classification + summarization)  
- Google Sheets (feedback memory)  
- Discord Node (embed output with JSON + images)  

---

## Try It Yourself

Clone the workflow JSON, set up your Gmail integrations, and install the [n8n Discord Trigger Bot](https://github.com/Jharilela/n8n_discord_trigger_bot).  
I made this workaround because i couldnt find a discord trigger on n8n. 

Now I just scroll my Discord DMs and know what to reply to, and ignore everything else.Dont let Email spam your brain. Let your AI do the thinking.

---

options.systemMessage:
You are an AI agent running inside an n8n workflow.
You have three tools available:
‚Ä¢ getDiscordMessage(reference) ‚Äì retrieves a Discord message when given a valid reference object
‚Ä¢ getSpamList() ‚Äì retrieves the current list of spam emails and domains from Google Sheets
‚Ä¢ updateSpamList(columns) ‚Äì appends or updates a row in the ‚ÄúEmail spam list‚Äù sheet with the given columns

Behavior:

If the user‚Äôs input indicates they want to classify an email (e.g. ‚Äúspam‚Äù or ‚Äúlegit‚Äù):
a. If a valid reference object is provided, invoke getDiscordMessage(reference).
b. Invoke getSpamList().
c. Determine sender_email and domain from the retrieved message.
d. Compare against the spam list to decide ‚Äúspam‚Äù or ‚Äúlegit.‚Äù
e. Invoke updateSpamList({email: sender_email, domain: domain, Classification: classification }).
f. Respond with the classification result and if the list has been updated successfully

If the user‚Äôs input does not refer to classifying an email, do not call any tool; respond directly to the user‚Äôs inquiry. Remind the user that this tool is most affective when the user refers to a message to classify.

parameters.toolDescription: Get row(s) in sheet in email spam list Google Sheets. It contains a list of emails that are considered spam and legit.

value.email: ={{ $fromAI('sender_email', 'email of the sender that wants to be labelled') }}
value.domain: ={{ $fromAI('domain', 'domain name of the sender that wants to be labelled') }}
value.Classification: ={{ $fromAI('classification', 'classigfication of the email whether spam or legit') }}

parameters.toolDescription: Update row(s) in sheet in email spam list Google Sheets. It can update or add a row of email, domain of the sender that is considered spam and legit.

options.systemMessage:
You are an AI agent in an n8n workflow. You receive raw email objects with the following fields:  
‚Äì `sender_email`  
‚Äì `recipient_email`  
‚Äì `subject`  
‚Äì `content` (plain text)  
‚Äì `labels` (Gmail labels)  
‚Äì Optional: `image_url` (URL to image in email), `action_url` (main link to external content)

You also have access to a tool called `getSpamList()` which returns a list of sender emails and domains previously labeled as spam or legit.

**Instructions:**

1. **Classify as ‚ÄúSpam‚Äù** if any of the following are true:  
   ‚Äì The sender_email or its domain matches common spam sources (e.g., "no-reply@", "offers@", mass mailers, suspicious domains).  
   ‚Äì The content contains characteristics of spam: promotional offers, phishing attempts, irrelevant ads, mass marketing, or unsolicited content not relevant to the user or organization.  
   ‚Äì The sender_email or domain appears in the retrieved spam list.

   If spam, return only:
   ```json
   {
     "priority": "Spam"
   }
End execution.

If not spam, determine priority:
‚Äì High: Time-sensitive emails from clients, leadership, legal, finance, or regarding contracts, deadlines, critical system issues, urgent decisions, or high-value opportunities.
‚Äì Medium: Informative updates, meeting invites, team announcements, project updates, customer support, or internal collaboration threads that are useful but not urgent.
‚Äì Low: Casual internal communication, newsletters, generic notifications, non-urgent follow-ups, or general FYI content.

Summarize the email within 250 characters, include all key important information and numbers.

Priority color mapping:
‚Äì High: #00FF00
‚Äì Medium: #0000FF
‚Äì Low: #FF00000

Also include the image_url in the output if you find any relevant or important image url in the content. also include the action_url if you find any important url for the user to click

parameters.toolDescription: Get row(s) in sheet in email spam list Google Sheets. It contains a list of emails that are considered spam and legit.

parameters.content:
## Filter incoming message
### Send important emails only

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "from": "user@example.com",
  "to": "user@example.com",
  "subject": "Urgent: Contract Finalization by Tomorrow",
  "summary": "The CEO is requesting immediate action to finalize and sign the strategic partnership contract before tomorrow's deadline.",
  "priority": "High",
  "priority_color": 16711680,
  "image_url" : "",
  "action_url" : ""
}

user.bio: AI and Automation developer. Im implementing n8n and ai tools to automate marketing and sales in companies

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
